translated: So it is with the phenomena of the spiritual practitioner.

original: de dag nam mkha' bzhin du gos pa med chos rnams //
analyzed: de dag nam mkha' bzhin du gos pa med chos rnams //
translated: Like space, phenomena are unstained.🔽Those spiritual practitioners who are well trained in this teaching,

original: chos 'dir dge sbyong gang dag legs par bslab rnams dang // gzhan dag slob pa rnams dang slob par 'gyur ba rnams //
analyzed: chos 'dir dge sbyong gang dag legs par bslab rnams dang // gzhan dag slob pa rnams dang slob par 'gyur ba rnams //
translated: Those who are training and those who will train,

original: 'di la nam du'ang gang dag 'chags par mi 'gyur ba //
analyzed: 'di la nam du'ang gang dag 'chags par mi 'gyur ba //
translated: Will never be defiled by this.

original: nga @13a *// yis de dag dge sbyong legs bslab rnams su bstan //
analyzed: nga @13a *// yis de dag dge sbyong legs bslab rnams su bstan //
translated: I declare them to be well-trained spiritual practitioners.

original: ji ltar mkha' la nam yang lag pa mi thogs dang // rdul dang du ba rnams kyis gos par mi 'gyur dang // ji ltar lam ni nam yang byed par mi 'gyur ba //
analyzed: ji ltar mkha' la nam yang lag pa mi thogs dang // rdul dang du ba rnams kyis gos par mi 'gyur dang // ji ltar lam ni nam yang byed par mi 'gyur ba //
translated: And just as the path is never made by walking,

original: chos la de bzhin mos pa rnams ni dge sbyong yin //🔽ji ltar sprin dang bral bar gyur ba'i nam mkha' la //
analyzed: chos la de bzhin mos pa rnams ni dge sbyong yin // ji ltar sprin dang bral bar gyur ba'i nam mkha' la //
translated: Those who have such conviction in the Dharma are true spiritual practitioners.🔽Just as the moon in a cloudless sky

original: zla ba thogs pa med par mkha' la 'gro byed kyang //
analyzed: zla ba thogs pa med par mkha' la 'gro byed kyang //
translated: Moves through the sky without obstruction,🔽And does not think,

original: bdag gis bar snang la ni snang bar bya snyam du //🔽de la rnam rtog de ni 'byung bar mi 'gyur bzhin //
analyzed: bdag gis bar snang la ni snang bar bya snyam du // de la rnam rtog de ni 'byung bar mi 'gyur bzhin //
translated: “I illuminate the sky,”🔽The moon-like monk, free from agitation,

original: rgod med bdag nyid dge slong zla ba lta bu yis; ;sbyin pa'i bdag po'i khyim rnams su ni 'gro bar bya //
analyzed: rgod med bdag nyid dge slong zla ba lta bu yis; ;sbyin pa'i bdag po'i khyim rnams su ni 'gro bar bya //
translated: Should go to the houses of the benefactors.🔽Free from agitation, with a liberated mind,

original: rgod med nga rgyal rnam grol sems dang ldan pa dang // 'jig rten chos rnams kyis ni ma gos sems ldan bya //
analyzed: rgod med nga rgyal rnam grol sems dang ldan pa dang // 'jig rten chos rnams kyis ni ma gos sems ldan bya //
translated: And with a mind unstained by worldly concerns,

original: khyim rnams la ni nga rgyal spangs nas bsten par bya //
analyzed: khyim rnams la ni nga rgyal spangs nas bsten par bya //
translated: Abandoning pride, he should go to the houses.

original: der phyin nas kyang chos nyid rab tu brjod par bya //
analyzed: der phyin nas kyang chos nyid rab tu brjod par bya //
translated: Having gone there, I will teach the ultimate truth.

original: bde dang rnyed pa'i phyir ni 'dod pa'ang spangs nas su //
analyzed: bde dang rnyed pa'i phyir ni 'dod pa'ang spangs nas su //
translated: Abandoning desire for the sake of happiness and gain,

original: 'jig rten rnam dag tshul khrims can du gnas par bya //
analyzed: 'jig rten rnam dag tshul khrims can du gnas par bya //
translated: I will abide in pure morality in the world.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa 'od srung chen po la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa 'od srung chen po la bka' stsal pa /
translated: Then the Blessed One said to the venerable Mahākāśyapa:

original: 'od srung longs shig /
analyzed: 'od srung longs shig /
translated: Kāśyapa, arise!

original: longs la rang gi stan la 'dug cig /
analyzed: longs la rang gi stan la 'dug cig /
translated: Arise and sit on your own seat.

original: 'od srung / khyod la chos kyi the tshom ji snyed yod pa de dag de bzhin gshegs pa la dris shig dang / 'od srung /
analyzed: 'od srung / khyod la chos kyi the tshom ji snyed yod pa de dag de bzhin gshegs pa la dris shig dang / 'od srung /
translated: Kāśyapa, ask the Tathāgata about whatever doubts you have regarding the Dharma.

original: ngas dris pa lan btab pas khyod kyi sems rangs @13b par bya'o //
analyzed: ngas dris pa lan btab pas khyod kyi sems rangs @13b par bya'o //
translated: Kāśyapa, I will satisfy your mind by answering your questions.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa 'od srung chen po sa'i steng de nas langs te bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la mgo bos phyag btsal nas phyogs gcig tu 'dug go /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa 'od srung chen po sa'i steng de nas langs te bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la mgo bos phyag btsal nas phyogs gcig tu 'dug go /
translated: Then the venerable Mahākāśyapa rose from the ground, bowed his head at the feet of the Blessed One, and sat to one side.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis yang rdzu 'phrul ji lta bu mngon par 'du bya ba mngon par 'du mdzad pas dzambu'i gling 'di na dge slong dang / dge slong ma dang / dge bsnyen dang / dge bsnyen ma ji snyed gnas pa de dag thams cad rgyal po'i khab 'od ma'i tshal bya ka lanta ka gnas pa ga la ba dang /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis yang rdzu 'phrul ji lta bu mngon par 'du bya ba mngon par 'du mdzad pas dzambu'i gling 'di na dge slong dang / dge slong ma dang / dge bsnyen dang / dge bsnyen ma ji snyed gnas pa de dag thams cad rgyal po'i khab 'od ma'i tshal bya ka lanta ka gnas pa ga la ba dang /
translated: Then the Blessed One, through his miraculous powers, caused all the monks, nuns, laymen, and laywomen who were dwelling in Jambudvīpa to gather in the Kalandaka­nivāpa in the Veṇuvana by Rājagṛha,

original: bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der dong ste lhags nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la mgo bos phyag btsal te phyogs gcig tu 'khod nas dge slong dang / dge slong ma dang / dge bsnyen dang / dge bsnyen ma dang / lha dang / klu dang /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der dong ste lhags nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la mgo bos phyag btsal te phyogs gcig tu 'khod nas dge slong dang / dge slong ma dang / dge bsnyen dang / dge bsnyen ma dang / lha dang / klu dang /
translated: where the Blessed One was staying. They approached the Blessed One, bowed their heads at his feet, and sat to one side. The monks, nuns, laymen, laywomen, gods, nāgas,

original: gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi 'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po gang dag yin pa de dag kyang 'od ma'i tshal bya ka lanta ka gnas par zhugs te /
analyzed: gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi 'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po gang dag yin pa de dag kyang 'od ma'i tshal bya ka lanta ka gnas par zhugs te /
translated: yakṣas, gandharvas, asuras, garuḍas, kinnaras, and mahoragas who had entered the Kalandaka­nivāpa in the Veṇuvana

original: de dag zhugs nas mtha' yas shing dpag tu med par shes par 'gyur ba de lta bu'i rdzu 'phrul mngon par 'du bya ba mngon par 'du mdzad do //
analyzed: de dag zhugs nas mtha' yas shing dpag tu med par shes par 'gyur ba de lta bu'i rdzu 'phrul mngon par 'du bya ba mngon par 'du mdzad do //
translated: Having entered, they will know that it is infinite and immeasurable.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis yang rdzu 'phrul ji lta bu mngon par 'du bya ba mngon par 'du mdzad pas /🔽stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams na rgyal po chen po bzhi dang / lha rnams kyi dbang po brgya byin dang / tshangs pa dang / tshangs pa chen po dang / 'od @14a *//
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis yang rdzu 'phrul ji lta bu mngon par 'du bya ba mngon par 'du mdzad pas / stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams na rgyal po chen po bzhi dang / lha rnams kyi dbang po brgya byin dang / tshangs pa dang / tshangs pa chen po dang / 'od @14a *//
translated: Then the Blessed One performed a miracle such that

original: gsal dang / mi che ba dang / mi gdung ba dang / shin tu mthong ba dang / 'og min gyi lha'i bu ji snyed pa de dag thams cad sangs rgyas kyi mthus rgyal po'i khab 'od ma'i tshal bya ka lanta ka gnas pa ga la ba dang /
analyzed: gsal dang / mi che ba dang / mi gdung ba dang / shin tu mthong ba dang / 'og min gyi lha'i bu ji snyed pa de dag thams cad sangs rgyas kyi mthus rgyal po'i khab 'od ma'i tshal bya ka lanta ka gnas pa ga la ba dang /
translated: all the gods of the great trichiliocosm, the Four Great Kings, Śakra, Brahmā, Mahābrahmā, Ābhāsvara, Avṛha, Atapa, Sudarśana, and Akaniṣṭha, by the power of the Buddha, went to the Kalandaka­nivāpa in the Veṇu­vana at Rājagṛha,🔽where the Blessed One was.

original: bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der dong ste lhags nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der dong ste lhags nas /
translated: Having arrived,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la mgo bos phyag btsal te phyogs gcig tu 'khod nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la mgo bos phyag btsal te phyogs gcig tu 'khod nas /
translated: They bowed their heads to the feet of the Blessed One and sat to one side.

original: bcom ldan 'das la thal mo sbyar te phyag 'tshal bar 'gyur ba de lta bu'i rdzu 'phrul mngon par 'du bya ba mngon par 'du mdzad do //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la thal mo sbyar te phyag 'tshal bar 'gyur ba de lta bu'i rdzu 'phrul mngon par 'du bya ba mngon par 'du mdzad do //
translated: Then, with palms joined, they bowed to the Blessed One.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis yang rdzu 'phrul ji lta bu mngon par 'du bya ba mngon par 'du mdzad pas klu'i rgyal po rgya mtsho dang / ma dros pa dang / snam bu'i dbang phyug dang / goo ta ma dang / dga' bo dang /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis yang rdzu 'phrul ji lta bu mngon par 'du bya ba mngon par 'du mdzad pas klu'i rgyal po rgya mtsho dang / ma dros pa dang / snam bu'i dbang phyug dang / goo ta ma dang / dga' bo dang /
translated: Then, through the Buddha’s power, the nāga kings Sāgara, Anavatapta, Pāṇḍarākṣa, Gautama, Nanda,

original: nye dga' dang / gzi can dang / 'jog po dang / rab mdzes dang / ae la'i 'dab dang / de dag dang / gzhan yang klu bye ba phrag stong sangs rgyas kyi mthus bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der dong ste lhags nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la mgo bos phyag btsal te /
analyzed: nye dga' dang / gzi can dang / 'jog po dang / rab mdzes dang / ae la'i 'dab dang / de dag dang / gzhan yang klu bye ba phrag stong sangs rgyas kyi mthus bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der dong ste lhags nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la mgo bos phyag btsal te /
translated: Upananda, Jyotiṣpāla, Takṣaka, Subhadra, and Aḍakavat, as well as a thousand million other nāgas, went to the Blessed One. When they arrived, they bowed their heads to the feet of the Blessed One.

original: phyogs gcig tu 'khod cing rgya chen po'i lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi 'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po dang / dge slong dang / dge slong ma dang /
analyzed: phyogs gcig tu 'khod cing rgya chen po'i lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi 'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po dang / dge slong dang / dge slong ma dang /
translated: The gods, nāgas, yakṣas, gandharvas, asuras, garuḍas, kinnaras, mahoragas, monks, nuns,

original: dge bsnyen dang / dge bsnyen ma de dag thams cad kyang sangs rgyas kyi mthus 'od ma'i tshal bya ka lanta ka @14b gnas par zhugs nas gcig la gcig nyam nga ba med pas 'khod par 'gyur ba de lta bu'i rdzu 'phrul mngon par 'du bya ba mngon par 'du mdzad do
analyzed: dge bsnyen dang / dge bsnyen ma de dag thams cad kyang sangs rgyas kyi mthus 'od ma'i tshal bya ka lanta ka @14b gnas par zhugs nas gcig la gcig nyam nga ba med pas 'khod par 'gyur ba de lta bu'i rdzu 'phrul mngon par 'du bya ba mngon par 'du mdzad do
translated: male and female lay practitioners, and all the others who had gathered there, were seated in the Kalandaka­nivāpa in the Veṇuvana to the west of Rājagṛha. Through the Buddha’s power, they were all seated there without any sense of discomfort.

original: // de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa moonggal gyi bu chen po la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: // de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa moonggal gyi bu chen po la bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One then said to the venerable Mahā­maudgalyāyana,

original: moonggal gyi bu /
analyzed: moonggal gyi bu /
translated: “Maudgalyāyana,

original: khyod longs la de bzhin gshegs pa'i gdan shoms shig /
analyzed: khyod longs la de bzhin gshegs pa'i gdan shoms shig /
translated: please prepare a seat for the Thus-Gone One.”

original: de bzhin gshegs pa de la bzhugs nas the tshom thams cad gcod pa zhes bya ba'i chos kyi rnam grangs yang dag par ston par 'gyur /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa de la bzhugs nas the tshom thams cad gcod pa zhes bya ba'i chos kyi rnam grangs yang dag par ston par 'gyur /
translated: Abiding in that thusness, he will teach the Dharma discourse called “Cutting Through All Doubts.”

original: sems can thams cad kyi bsam pa sgrub pa'i spyod pa yang dag par ston par 'gyur /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi bsam pa sgrub pa'i spyod pa yang dag par ston par 'gyur /
translated: He will teach the conduct that fulfills the wishes of all sentient beings.

original: sems can thams cad yang dag par tshim pa'i chos kyi rnam grangs yang dag par ston par 'gyur /
analyzed: sems can thams cad yang dag par tshim pa'i chos kyi rnam grangs yang dag par ston par 'gyur /
translated: He will teach the Dharma discourse that completely satisfies all sentient beings.

original: sems can thams cad chos la yang dag par gzhol ba'i tshul gyi sgo rgya mtsho'i phyag rgya yang dag par ston par 'gyur /
analyzed: sems can thams cad chos la yang dag par gzhol ba'i tshul gyi sgo rgya mtsho'i phyag rgya yang dag par ston par 'gyur /
translated: He will teach the ocean seal gateway, the way to bring all sentient beings to the Dharma.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams gyi spyod pa sgrub pa yang dag par ston par 'gyur /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams gyi spyod pa sgrub pa yang dag par ston par 'gyur /
translated: He will teach the accomplishment of the conduct of bodhisattva mahāsattvas.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos sgrub pa yang dag par ston par 'gyur; sems can yongs su smin par bya ba sgrub pa yang dag par ston par 'gyur /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos sgrub pa yang dag par ston par 'gyur; sems can yongs su smin par bya ba sgrub pa yang dag par ston par 'gyur /
translated: He will teach the accomplishment of the buddhadharmas. He will teach the accomplishment of ripening sentient beings.

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa sgrub pa yang dag par ston par 'gyur ba nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgrub pa'i bar du yang dag par ston par 'gyur /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa sgrub pa yang dag par ston par 'gyur ba nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgrub pa'i bar du yang dag par ston par 'gyur /
translated: They will teach the practice of the perfection of generosity, and they will teach the practice of the perfection of insight.

original: chos thams cad kyi tshul gyi sgo sgrub pa yang dag par ston par 'gyur /🔽sems can thams cad kyi dbang po sgrub pa @15a *//
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi tshul gyi sgo sgrub pa yang dag par ston par 'gyur / sems can thams cad kyi dbang po sgrub pa @15a *//
translated: They will teach the practice of the gateway of the way of all phenomena.

original: yang dag par ston par 'gyur /
analyzed: yang dag par ston par 'gyur /
translated: They will teach the practice of the faculties of all sentient beings.

original: sems can thams cad kyi gnas pa'i spyod pa sgrub pa yang dag par ston par yang 'gyur /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi gnas pa'i spyod pa sgrub pa yang dag par ston par yang 'gyur /
translated: They will teach the practice of the conduct of the abodes of all sentient beings.

original: 'khor bzhi yang dag par tshim par byed par 'gyur /
analyzed: 'khor bzhi yang dag par tshim par byed par 'gyur /
translated: They will satisfy the fourfold assembly.

original: lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po'i 'khor kyang yang dag par tshim par byed par 'gyur /
analyzed: lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po'i 'khor kyang yang dag par tshim par byed par 'gyur /
translated: They will satisfy the retinues of gods, nāgas, yakṣas, gandharvas, asuras, garuḍas, kinnaras, and mahoragas.

original: 'das pa'i dus la ma chags ma thogs pa'i ye shes mthong ba dang / de bzhin du da ltar dang / ma 'ongs pa'i dus la ma chags ma thogs pa'i ye shes mthong ba dang / las kyi rnam par smin pa dang / spyod pa dang /
analyzed: 'das pa'i dus la ma chags ma thogs pa'i ye shes mthong ba dang / de bzhin du da ltar dang / ma 'ongs pa'i dus la ma chags ma thogs pa'i ye shes mthong ba dang / las kyi rnam par smin pa dang / spyod pa dang /
translated: the wisdom vision that is unattached and unobstructed with regard to the past,🔽the wisdom vision that is unattached and unobstructed with regard to the present, and the wisdom vision that is unattached and unobstructed with regard to the future.

original: smon lam rnams dang / ye shes kyi phyogs tsam zhig yang dag par ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: smon lam rnams dang / ye shes kyi phyogs tsam zhig yang dag par ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: He will teach a mere fraction of the wisdom that is related to the ripening of karma, conduct,🔽and aspirations.”

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa moonggal gyi bu chen po stan las langs te /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa moonggal gyi bu chen po stan las langs te /
translated: Then the venerable Mahā­maudgalyāyana rose from his seat,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la mgo bos phyag btsal nas; bcom ldan 'das kyi gdan 'phang du tshangs pa'i 'jig rten srid cig bshams so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la mgo bos phyag btsal nas; bcom ldan 'das kyi gdan 'phang du tshangs pa'i 'jig rten srid cig bshams so //
translated: bowed his head at the feet of the Blessed One, and arranged a seat for the Blessed One that reached up to the Brahma realm.

original: steng gi bar snang la'ang bcom ldan 'das kyi 'chag sa rin po che sna bdun las byas pa ka tsa linda'i gos ltar reg na bde ba /
analyzed: steng gi bar snang la'ang bcom ldan 'das kyi 'chag sa rin po che sna bdun las byas pa ka tsa linda'i gos ltar reg na bde ba /
translated: In the sky above, there was a walkway for the Blessed One made of the seven precious substances, soft to the touch like kācilindika cloth,

original: srid kyi tshad ni /
analyzed: srid kyi tshad ni /
translated: and its height

original: stong gi 'jig rten gyi khams dang ldan pa /
analyzed: stong gi 'jig rten gyi khams dang ldan pa /
translated: was equal to the height of a thousand world systems.

original: rgyar ni; dpag tshad bdun brgya dang ldan pa zhig byas so //
analyzed: rgyar ni; dpag tshad bdun brgya dang ldan pa zhig byas so //
translated: It was seven hundred leagues wide.

original: 'chag sa de la'ang rtsig pa rim pa bdun dang / rta babs rim pa bdun dang / stegs bu rim pa bdun dang / dril bu g-yer ka'i @15b dra ba rim pa bdun gyis kun nas bskor ba sprul to //🔽'chags de'i g-yas g-yon du'ang 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'chag sa de la'ang rtsig pa rim pa bdun dang / rta babs rim pa bdun dang / stegs bu rim pa bdun dang / dril bu g-yer ka'i @15b dra ba rim pa bdun gyis kun nas bskor ba sprul to // 'chags de'i g-yas g-yon du'ang 'di lta ste /
translated: He emanated a walkway that was surrounded by seven successive walls, seven successive railings, seven successive nets, and seven successive trees.

original: gser dang / dngul dang / shel dang / beed'urya rin po che sna bzhi'i shing ljon pa dag mngon par sprul to //
analyzed: gser dang / dngul dang / shel dang / beed'urya rin po che sna bzhi'i shing ljon pa dag mngon par sprul to //
translated: To the right and left of the walkway he emanated trees made of the four precious substances:🔽gold, silver, crystal, and beryl.🔽The trees made of gold had leaves of silver, flowers of crystal, and fruits of beryl.

original: gser las byas pa'i shing ljon pa rnams la dngul gyi lo ma dag dang / shel gyi me tog dag dang / bee d'urya las byas pa'i 'bras bu dag dang / dngul las byas pa'i shing ljon pa rnams la gser gyi lo ma dag dang /
analyzed: gser las byas pa'i shing ljon pa rnams la dngul gyi lo ma dag dang / shel gyi me tog dag dang / bee d'urya las byas pa'i 'bras bu dag dang / dngul las byas pa'i shing ljon pa rnams la gser gyi lo ma dag dang /
translated: The trees made of silver had leaves of gold,

original: beed'urya las byas pa'i me tog dag dang / shel las byas pa'i 'bras bu dag dang / beed'urya las byas pa'i shing ljon pa rnams la gser gyi lo ma dag dang / dngul gyi me tog dag dang / shel gyi 'bras bu dag dang / shel las byas pa'i shing ljon pa rnams la gser gyi lo ma dag dang /
analyzed: beed'urya las byas pa'i me tog dag dang / shel las byas pa'i 'bras bu dag dang / beed'urya las byas pa'i shing ljon pa rnams la gser gyi lo ma dag dang / dngul gyi me tog dag dang / shel gyi 'bras bu dag dang / shel las byas pa'i shing ljon pa rnams la gser gyi lo ma dag dang /
translated: He manifested flowers made of beryl, fruits made of crystal, and trees made of beryl with golden leaves, silver flowers, and crystal fruits.🔽He manifested trees made of crystal with golden leaves,

original: dngul gyi me tog dag dang / beed'urya las byas pa'i 'bras bu dag mngon par sprul to //
analyzed: dngul gyi me tog dag dang / beed'urya las byas pa'i 'bras bu dag mngon par sprul to //
translated: silver flowers, and beryl fruits.

translated: and which is filled with the undefiled Dharma,

original: bri ba'ang med pa dang / gting dpag dka' ba dang / mi 'khrug pa dang / chos thams cad kyi ye shes kyi phyag rgya dang / ji ltar rgya mtsho chen po mi'i ro dang lhan cig tu mi gnas pa de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa lta ba thibs po thams cad kyis chud zos pa'i sems can rnams dang lhan cig mi gnas pa dang /
analyzed: bri ba'ang med pa dang / gting dpag dka' ba dang / mi 'khrug pa dang / chos thams cad kyi ye shes kyi phyag rgya dang / ji ltar rgya mtsho chen po mi'i ro dang lhan cig tu mi gnas pa de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa lta ba thibs po thams cad kyis chud zos pa'i sems can rnams dang lhan cig mi gnas pa dang /
translated: It is difficult to fathom its depth. It is undisturbed. It is the wisdom seal of all phenomena. Just as the great ocean does not remain together with a human corpse, the Thus-Gone One does not remain together with sentient beings who are ruined by the darkness of wrong views.

original: ji ltar rgya mtsho chen po 'di lta ste /
analyzed: ji ltar rgya mtsho chen po 'di lta ste /
translated: The great ocean is, for example,🔽of one taste: the taste of salt. In the same way, the Thus-Gone One’s liberation is of one taste.

original: lan tshva'i ror ro gcig pa de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam par grol bar ro gcig par 'gyur ba'i chos kyi rnam grangs de lta bu de thos shing /
analyzed: lan tshva'i ror ro gcig pa de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam par grol bar ro gcig par 'gyur ba'i chos kyi rnam grangs de lta bu de thos shing /
translated: When they hear such a Dharma discourse,

original: de dag de skad ces thos nas khong du chud par mi byed cing mngon par yid ches par mi byed la mos par mi byed de /🔽de lta ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag de skad ces thos nas khong du chud par mi byed cing mngon par yid ches par mi byed la mos par mi byed de / de lta ma yin no //
translated: they do not understand it, do not believe it, and do not have faith in it.

original: zhes tshig smra par byed do //
analyzed: zhes tshig smra par byed do //
translated: They say, ‘That is not the case.’

original: bzang skyong / mi blun po de dag bdag cag gis ci shes she'am /
analyzed: bzang skyong / mi blun po de dag bdag cag gis ci shes she'am /
translated: Bhadrapāla, look how those fools do not think, ‘What do we know?

original: bdag cag gis ji snyed bslab ces de ltar yang lta bar mi 'gyur ba la ltos /
analyzed: bdag cag gis ji snyed bslab ces de ltar yang lta bar mi 'gyur ba la ltos /
translated: What have we learned?’

original: re zhig bdag cag nyid kyi spyod pa'ang mi shes pa dang / bdag cag gi las spyad ces gnas mi shes pa dang / las mi shes pa dang / rnam par smin pa mi shes pa dang @41a *//
analyzed: re zhig bdag cag nyid kyi spyod pa'ang mi shes pa dang / bdag cag gi las spyad ces gnas mi shes pa dang / las mi shes pa dang / rnam par smin pa mi shes pa dang @41a *//
translated: ‘We do not even know our own conduct, we do not know our own actions, we do not know the results of our actions,

original: bdag cag las gang gis 'dir skyes pa dang / bdag cag ga las 'dir skyes pa dang / bdag cag gi 'gro ba'ang gang yin pa dang / bdag cag rnam pa ji lta bu dang / sbyor ba ji lta bu dang / bdag cag shes pa dang ldan zhing las byed dam /
analyzed: bdag cag las gang gis 'dir skyes pa dang / bdag cag ga las 'dir skyes pa dang / bdag cag gi 'gro ba'ang gang yin pa dang / bdag cag rnam pa ji lta bu dang / sbyor ba ji lta bu dang / bdag cag shes pa dang ldan zhing las byed dam /
translated: we do not know by what actions we were born here, we do not know from where we were born here, we do not know what our future destiny will be,🔽we do not know what kind of beings we are, we do not know what kind of actions we have done, we do not know whether we are wise and do actions,

original: shes pa dang mi ldan zhing las byed ces de dag gis de skad ces bdag nyid brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: shes pa dang mi ldan zhing las byed ces de dag gis de skad ces bdag nyid brjod par bya'o //
translated: or whether we are unwise and do actions.’🔽“

original: gal te chos de dag la mi blun po de dag chos kyi 'du shes dang / nga'i bsngags pa ma yin pa'i 'du shes bskyed na /
analyzed: gal te chos de dag la mi blun po de dag chos kyi 'du shes dang / nga'i bsngags pa ma yin pa'i 'du shes bskyed na /
translated: If those fools have the idea that those teachings are not the Dharma, and the idea that my praise is not praise,

original: nga'i tshig gis mi blun po de dag mdo sde dag la mi rton par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nga'i tshig gis mi blun po de dag mdo sde dag la mi rton par 'gyur ro //
translated: then by my words those fools will not rely on the sūtras.

original: nga 'das nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i bsngags pa brjod pa dang / chos kyi bsngags pa brjod pa dang / dge 'dun gyi bsngags pa brjod pa na de la khyed cag gis mi gus par mi bya zhing yid mi ches par ma yin la /
analyzed: nga 'das nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i bsngags pa brjod pa dang / chos kyi bsngags pa brjod pa dang / dge 'dun gyi bsngags pa brjod pa na de la khyed cag gis mi gus par mi bya zhing yid mi ches par ma yin la /
translated: After I have passed into nirvāṇa, when the praise of the Tathāgata is spoken, when the praise of the Dharma is spoken, and when the praise of the Saṅgha is spoken, you should not be disrespectful, you should not be without confidence,

original: sems gzhan du 'gyur ba dang / mngon par mi dga' bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: sems gzhan du 'gyur ba dang / mngon par mi dga' bar mi bya'o //
translated: and you should not have a different thought or be displeased.

original: zhes kyang de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes kyang de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs so //
translated: The Tathāgata has also said this:

original: gal te de la ngas gdams ngag bskyed par bya na /
analyzed: gal te de la ngas gdams ngag bskyed par bya na /
translated: If I were to give them instruction,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: it would be like this:

original: zhe 'gras pa'i sems dang ldan pa de ni /
analyzed: zhe 'gras pa'i sems dang ldan pa de ni /
translated: Those who have a mind of hostility

original: dge sbyong gi chos ma yin zhing /
analyzed: dge sbyong gi chos ma yin zhing /
translated: do not have the qualities of an ascetic,🔽and they have in common with non-ascetics

original: dge sbyong ma yin pa dang thun mong pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: dge sbyong ma yin pa dang thun mong pa 'di lta ste /
translated: the following:

original: dge sbyong ma yin pa rnams dang / dge sbyong ma yin pa thun mong ba'i lam la zhugs pa'i gnas de ni /
analyzed: dge sbyong ma yin pa rnams dang / dge sbyong ma yin pa thun mong ba'i lam la zhugs pa'i gnas de ni /
translated: “This is the path shared with non-monastics,

original: skyon mang po'i shas che ba yin zhing /
analyzed: skyon mang po'i shas che ba yin zhing /
translated: and it is a place of many faults.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi byang chub gting @41b dpag dka' ba yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi byang chub gting @41b dpag dka' ba yin te /
translated: The enlightenment of the Thus-Gone Ones is difficult to fathom,

original: de'i phyir bdag gis dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams kho na bsten par bya'o //🔽zhes gdams par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir bdag gis dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams kho na bsten par bya'o // zhes gdams par bya'o //
translated: so I will rely on the applications of mindfulness alone.”

original: bzang skyong / de la chos thams cad ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dag ni; mi gnas pa dag nyid de /
analyzed: bzang skyong / de la chos thams cad ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dag ni; mi gnas pa dag nyid de /
translated: “Bhadrapāla, all phenomena are by nature non-abiding,

original: chos thams cad de ltar gnas pa dag nyid rnam par mi rtog pa dag go /🔽bzang skyong / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad de ltar gnas pa dag nyid rnam par mi rtog pa dag go / bzang skyong / 'di lta ste /
translated: and all phenomena that abide in this way are non-conceptual.

original: 'jug pa'i sgo dang / rtogs pa'i sgo dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo de ni /
analyzed: 'jug pa'i sgo dang / rtogs pa'i sgo dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo de ni /
translated: Bhadrapāla, this is the gateway

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams kyi sgo yin no //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams kyi sgo yin no //
translated: to the applications of mindfulness,🔽which is the gateway to the realization of the non-abiding nature of all phenomena.

original: bzang skyong / gnas dang gnas ma yin pa de ni /
analyzed: bzang skyong / gnas dang gnas ma yin pa de ni /
translated: Bhadrapāla, the distinction between what is possible and impossible

original: gnyis yin no //
analyzed: gnyis yin no //
translated: is twofold.

original: bzang skyong / yang dag pa'i lta ba dang mtha' mi dmigs pa'i phyir mtha' rnam par spangs pa ni /
analyzed: bzang skyong / yang dag pa'i lta ba dang mtha' mi dmigs pa'i phyir mtha' rnam par spangs pa ni /
translated: Bhadrapāla, the abandonment of extremes is due to the non-apprehension of the extremes of the correct view.

original: gnyis la ma chags pa yin no //
analyzed: gnyis la ma chags pa yin no //
translated: Bhadrapāla, the abandonment of extremes is non-attachment to the two due to the non-apprehension of the correct view and its extremes.

original: bzang skyong / de bzhin gshegs pas mtha' ma brnyes pa'i phyir mtha' rnam par spangs pa ma yin mod kyi /
analyzed: bzang skyong / de bzhin gshegs pas mtha' ma brnyes pa'i phyir mtha' rnam par spangs pa ma yin mod kyi /
translated: Bhadrapāla, the Tathāgata does not abandon extremes because he has attained the end,

original: 'on kyang gang gi phyir mi dmigs pa de nyid kyi phyir de bzhin gshegs pas de rnam par spangs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang gang gi phyir mi dmigs pa de nyid kyi phyir de bzhin gshegs pas de rnam par spangs pa yin no //
translated: but rather because he does not apprehend them, the Tathāgata has abandoned them.

original: bzang skyong / de bzhin gshegs pas rnam par spangs pa'i chos de dag ji ltar byis pa dag gis bzung ba de bzhin du mkhas pa dag 'dzin par mi byed do //
analyzed: bzang skyong / de bzhin gshegs pas rnam par spangs pa'i chos de dag ji ltar byis pa dag gis bzung ba de bzhin du mkhas pa dag 'dzin par mi byed do //
translated: Bhadrapāla, the wise do not grasp those phenomena that are abandoned by the Tathāgata in the same way that fools grasp them.

original: bzang skyong / ji ltar chos rnams kyi chos kyi mtshan nyid de ltar rnam par spangs pa ma yin zhing /
analyzed: bzang skyong / ji ltar chos rnams kyi chos kyi mtshan nyid de ltar rnam par spangs pa ma yin zhing /
translated: Bhadrapāla, the defining characteristic of phenomena is not abandoned in that way,

original: yang dag par 'das pa ma yin la bor ba ma yin zhing rnyed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: yang dag par 'das pa ma yin la bor ba ma yin zhing rnyed pa ma yin no //
translated: nor is it transcended, nor discarded, nor attained.

original: bzang skyong / gang nga'i thad du phyin nas 'di skad ces smra ba'i lha de'i tshig lan ngas 'di skad ces btab ste /
analyzed: bzang skyong / gang nga'i thad du phyin nas 'di skad ces smra ba'i lha de'i tshig lan ngas 'di skad ces btab ste /
translated: “Bhadrapāla, I replied to the god who came to me and said this:

original: dge sbyong / dgyes pa mdzad @42a *//
analyzed: dge sbyong / dgyes pa mdzad @42a *//
translated: ‘Monk, are you pleased?🔽’

original: dam; ngas smras pa /
analyzed: dam; ngas smras pa /
translated: I said:

original: lha / ngas ci rnyed /
analyzed: lha / ngas ci rnyed /
translated: ‘God, what have I obtained?🔽’

original: dge sbyong / thugs ngan mdzad dam /
analyzed: dge sbyong / thugs ngan mdzad dam /
translated: ‘Monk, are you displeased?🔽’

original: ngas smras pa /
analyzed: ngas smras pa /
translated: I said:

original: lha / nga'i ci chud zos /
analyzed: lha / nga'i ci chud zos /
translated: ‘God, what have I lost?🔽’

original: des gsol pa /
analyzed: des gsol pa /
translated: He said:

original: dge sbyong / dgyes pa'ang ma lags /
analyzed: dge sbyong / dgyes pa'ang ma lags /
translated: ‘Monk, I am neither pleased

original: thugs ngan yang mi mdzad pa ni /
analyzed: thugs ngan yang mi mdzad pa ni /
translated: nor displeased.

original: dge sbyong / legs so //
analyzed: dge sbyong / legs so //
translated: Monk, that is excellent!

original: lags so // bzang skyong /
analyzed: lags so // bzang skyong /
translated: Yes, Bhadrapāla,

original: lha de 'khor 'di nyid du 'dus par gyur nas 'dug ste /
analyzed: lha de 'khor 'di nyid du 'dus par gyur nas 'dug ste /
translated: that god has gathered in this very retinue and is sitting here.

original: bzang skyong des chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa dag kun tu shes so //
analyzed: bzang skyong des chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa dag kun tu shes so //
translated: Bhadrapāla, he understands that all phenomena are naturally completely liberated.

original: lha des ni /
analyzed: lha des ni /
translated: That god

original: sngon sangs rgyas lnga brgya dag mnyes par byas te /
analyzed: sngon sangs rgyas lnga brgya dag mnyes par byas te /
translated: has pleased five hundred buddhas in the past.

original: de dag mnyes par byas pas lha de de ltar mngon par shes pa myur bar gyur to //
analyzed: de dag mnyes par byas pas lha de de ltar mngon par shes pa myur bar gyur to //
translated: Because he has pleased them, that god has become so quick in higher knowledge.

original: bzang skyong / sems can dge ba'i rtsa ba ma bskyed pa rnams dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su ma smin pa rnams chos de dag la 'dul ba'i phyir mos par nga mi smra'o //
analyzed: bzang skyong / sems can dge ba'i rtsa ba ma bskyed pa rnams dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su ma smin pa rnams chos de dag la 'dul ba'i phyir mos par nga mi smra'o //
translated: Bhadrapāla, I do not say that those sentient beings who have not planted the roots of virtue and whose roots of virtue have not ripened will have interest in those dharmas in order to be disciplined.

original: de bzhin du nyan thos rnams kyi mos pa ma mthong ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du nyan thos rnams kyi mos pa ma mthong ngo //
translated: In the same way, I do not see that the śrāvakas have interest.

original: bzang skyong / chos de dag gang la las thos nas thos pa'i mod la mos par 'gyur pa'am /
analyzed: bzang skyong / chos de dag gang la las thos nas thos pa'i mod la mos par 'gyur pa'am /
translated: Bhadrapāla, those who hear those dharmas and have interest in them the moment they hear them,

original: dad par 'gyur ba'am /🔽yid ches par 'gyur ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de ni /
analyzed: dad par 'gyur ba'am / yid ches par 'gyur ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de ni /
translated: or have faith in them,🔽or have confidence in them,

original: nang gi chung dur 'gyur te /🔽de'i gong na shes rab kyi phung po'i ye shes shin tu rgyas pas ye shes la 'jug pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams ni /
analyzed: nang gi chung dur 'gyur te / de'i gong na shes rab kyi phung po'i ye shes shin tu rgyas pas ye shes la 'jug pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams ni /
translated: those roots of virtue are the smallest.

original: rgya che bar blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: rgya che bar blta bar bya'o //
translated: Above that, the roots of virtue that engage with wisdom should be seen as vast, because of the vastness of the wisdom of the aggregate of wisdom.

original: de nas bzang skyong la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa' lnga brgya tsam po da dag gis bcom ldan 'das la lag pa lta bu'i padma des @42b gtor cing mngon par gtor nas tshig 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas bzang skyong la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa' lnga brgya tsam po da dag gis bcom ldan 'das la lag pa lta bu'i padma des @42b gtor cing mngon par gtor nas tshig 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the five hundred bodhisattvas, headed by Bhadrapāla, scattered and strewed those lotus flowers like hands over the Lord, and said this:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Lord!

original: gang dag lag pa lta bu'i padma'i chos kyi rnam grangs de la dmigs nas yongs su tshol bar bgyid pa'am /
analyzed: gang dag lag pa lta bu'i padma'i chos kyi rnam grangs de la dmigs nas yongs su tshol bar bgyid pa'am /
translated: All those who, having taken up this Dharma discourse called ‘Lotus Flower Like Hands,’

original: nyan par bgyid pa de dag thams cad bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu nges par 'gyur lags so //
analyzed: nyan par bgyid pa de dag thams cad bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu nges par 'gyur lags so //
translated: will seek it or listen to it will be destined for unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Lord!

original: phyogs bcu na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang dag bzhugs te 'tsho zhing gzhes pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas de dag la'ang dmigs pa des 'di lta ste /
analyzed: phyogs bcu na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang dag bzhugs te 'tsho zhing gzhes pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas de dag la'ang dmigs pa des 'di lta ste /
translated: Those tathāgatas, arhats, perfectly awakened buddhas, the lords of the worlds who dwell, remain, and live in the ten directions, by that very reference

original: sems can rnams kyi byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos yongs su smin par bgyi pa'i slad du chos bstan par gsol ba 'debs lags so //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos yongs su smin par bgyi pa'i slad du chos bstan par gsol ba 'debs lags so //
translated: I request that you teach the Dharma so that the factors of awakening of sentient beings may be brought to maturity.”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis mkhyen bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bzang skyong la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis mkhyen bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bzang skyong la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: Then the Blessed One, as if he knew, said to the bodhisattva great being Bhadrapāla,

original: bzang skyong / khyod la sems can rnams kyis phan btags sam ci na gang gi phyir khyod sems can rnams kyi byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir sems can rnams kyi don du go cha bgos shing /
analyzed: bzang skyong / khyod la sems can rnams kyis phan btags sam ci na gang gi phyir khyod sems can rnams kyi byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir sems can rnams kyi don du go cha bgos shing /
translated: “Bhadrapāla, have sentient beings ever benefited you in any way, that you have armored yourself for the sake of sentient beings in order to bring the factors of awakening of sentient beings to maturity,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas de dag la'ang chos bstan par gsol ba 'debs /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas de dag la'ang chos bstan par gsol ba 'debs /
translated: and that you request the thus-gone, worthy, perfect buddhas to teach the Dharma?”
